title: Aukus: French president says Australian PM lied over submarine deal
description: Asked if Australia's leader was untruthful, France's president responds: "I don't think, I know."

title: Who scored a goal 'like a meteorite' to make Garth Crooks' team of the week?
description: Who scored a goal like a meteorite? Who should Palace sign? Who misses out because Garth hates the position he played in? It's the team of the week.

title: 'Mature' Harrison 'sensational' in record win over New Zealand
description: Head coach Simon Middleton hails "sensational" fly-half Zoe Harrison after England's record win against New Zealand in Exeter.

title: Glaswegians greet COP26 with pessimism and hope
description: BBC Scotland speaks to people living and working around the climate summit in Glasgow.

title: Stars of music enter the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame
description: Carole King, Jay-Z and Foo Fighters and others were inducted at a star studded Rock and Roll Hall of Fame ceremony.

title: Igor Kirillov: TV man known as the face of the USSR dies at 89
description: Soviet TV's chief newsreader anchored major events in the country that collapsed in 1991.

title: Haverfordwest: Three die on paddleboarding river trip
description: Two women and a man died at the scene, while a fourth person is in a critical condition in hospital.

title: Greta Thunberg: Sometimes you need to anger people, says activist
description: Greta Thunberg says protesters must ensure no-one is hurt but defends tactics of blocking roads.

title: COP26: 'Moment of truth' as world meets for climate summit
description: COP26 begins in Glasgow, amid dire warnings for the future if urgent climate action is not taken.

title: UK and France seek solution to Brexit fishing row
description: Boris Johnson and Emmanuel Macron discuss the ongoing tensions in Rome and agree to work together.

title: G20 in final push to reach deal on climate at Rome summit
description: The leaders of the world's richest economies are looking for an agreement ahead of COP26.

title: JCB signs green hydrogen deal worth billions
description: JCB will take 10% of the green hydrogen made by Australian mining company Fortescue Future Industries.

title: 'Father of tiramisu' Ado Campeol dies aged 93
description: Campeol owned a restaurant in Italy where the dessert was invented by his wife and a pastry chef.

title: COP26: How Glasgow is hosting world leaders
description: About 120 world leaders from US President Joe Biden to the prime minister of Andorra will be in Glasgow for COP26.

title: Covid-19 vaccine: Jabs offered to 12-15-year-olds at 800 schools
description: Health Secretary Sajid Javid says the vaccines "will help keep children in the classroom".

title: Zaha calls for action after receiving racist abuse on Instagram
description: Wilfried Zaha calls on authorities to take racism seriously after he was sent racist abuse following Crystal Palace's win over Manchester City.

title: Black History Month: Five sportspeople whose hair is their magic
description: Patsy Goodwin looks at five athletes who have made their hair their superpower and inspired a generation of young black people to do the same.

title: The Papers: 'Rein in Macron', and 'gladiatorial' moment for Boris
description: The fishing row and COP26 feature prominently on several of Sunday's front pages.

title: Afghanistan: Gunmen attack wedding to stop music being played
description: The attack by men who identified themselves as Taliban has left at least two dead, officials say.

title: ‘As a child I saw the plane crash that killed my sisters'
description: Harriet was waving her sisters off when the plane left the runway and burned. Now she's finding others linked to the tragedy.

title: The white student braving racial politics in South Africa
description: Jess Griesel faces a backlash for joining a party that backs the interests of poor black South Africans.

title: 'I want to give my autistic son a voice'
description: A mother's new comic about neurodiverse children tackles the stigma around autism in India.

title: Can COP26 really save the planet?
description: Past COPs our science editor went to didn't stop climate change - will this one be any different?

title: Climate change: What's it like living in a place where it's 50C?
description: The BBC has spoken to people around the world about how extreme heat is changing their lives.
